titles.title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 710 Wick Lane in Billings, Montana, as the "Ronald Reagan Post Office Building".
A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 710 Wick Lane in Billings, Montana, as the "Ronald Reagan Post Office Building".

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Collins without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 150.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.
Ms. Ros-Lehtinen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 867.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Designates the U.S. Postal Service facility located at 710 Wicks Lane in Billings, Montana, as the Ronald Reagan Post Office Building.
